description:
Goku and company were living peaceful lives when they suddenly turned small due to a conspiracy! When they discover that the reason for this may lie in a world known as the "Demon Realm", a mysterious young Majin named Glorio appears before them.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ドラゴンボール ダイマ

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

title.native: ドラゴンボールZ: 神と神

node.description:
He debuted in 1979 with the story [Wonder Island](https://anilist.co/manga/112596/Wonder-Island/), published in Weekly Shounen Jump, and first gained popularity for the anime and manga series [Dr. Slump](https://anilist.co/manga/30796/Dr-Slump/), originally serialized weekly in Shounen Jump from 1980 to 1984. In 1982, he won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Dr. Slump for best shounen or shoujo manga series of the year.  In 1984, Toriyama was responsible for developing [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/manga/30042/Dragon-Ball/) which was initially serialized in Weekly Shōnen Jump. It became an instant accomplishment—primarily selling over 35,000,000 copies in Japan, Dragon Ball eventually became a record-breaking best seller with over 120,000,000 copies sold. Aside from the Japanese fame, the series was equally successful internationally as well, including in Europe (1988), Canada (1996) and Latin America. Its success encouraged Toriyama to continue working on Dragon Ball from 1984 to 1995. During that eleven-year period, he produced 519 chapters, collected into 42 volumes. Each volume has an average of 200 pages. Moreover, the benefit of the manga led to three anime adaptations, numerous feature-length animated movies, several video games, and mega-merchandising. Toriyama's studio is called "Bird Studio", which is a play on his name, "tori" meaning "bird."

Toriyama married his wife [Yoshimi Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/311142/Nachi-Mikami) on May 2, 1982. She is a former manga artist from Nagoya under the pen name "Nachi Mikami" and occasionally helped Toriyama and his assistant on Dr. Slump when they were short on time. Together with his wife, he had two children: a son born in 1987, and a daughter born in 1990. He was a well-known recluse, who avoided appearing in public or media.

On March 8, 2024, it was announced that Toriyama passed away at the age of 68 from acute subdural hematoma.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中鶴勝祥)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Most known for his work in the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) franchise.
__Yukinojou Mori__ is a poet, lyricist and composer born in Tokyo, Japan. He is affiliated with Amuse.

[Official Site](https://www.zedd.net/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/zedd) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zedd) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPNokRZ9hacjIQ3IQL6HNUQ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Zedd) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2qxJFvFYMEDqd7ui6kSAcq)

German music producer and DJ. In 2012, he released "Clarity" (featuring Foxes), which propelled him to mainstream success, reaching the 8th position on the Billboard Hot 100 and earning him a Grammy for Best Dance Recording at the 56th Grammy Awards.

[Official Site](https://c-and-k.info/) | [Profile (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/c-and-k) | [Twitter](https://x.com/CK_STAFF) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVqmAHnWTSTgV2bsn6GJn1w)

Japanese singer-songwriter duo featuring CLIEVY and [KEEN](https://anilist.co/staff/344174). The two members met in college and began performing together.

[Official Site](https://www.zedd.net/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/zedd) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zedd) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPNokRZ9hacjIQ3IQL6HNUQ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Zedd) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2qxJFvFYMEDqd7ui6kSAcq)

German music producer and DJ. In 2012, he released "Clarity" (featuring Foxes), which propelled him to mainstream success, reaching the 8th position on the Billboard Hot 100 and earning him a Grammy for Best Dance Recording at the 56th Grammy Awards.

[Twitter](https://x.com/keen_ck)

Singer-songwriter and half of the duo [*C&K*](https://anilist.co/staff/344173).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bgartistsaim) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/maya_kasai/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/maya.chimne) 

Art Director affiliated with Toei Animation Co Ltd.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中鶴勝祥)
